advice.message:
1. Use 'Manual JDBC configuration' and copy the URL from AWS console.
2. Redshift should be PUBLIC ACCESSIBLE and member of a public security group

The database server uses a configuration file pg_hba.conf to control which hosts are allowed to connect.
By default Postgres allows only connections from the same computer.
The pg_hba.conf file has to be edited and the server restarted.
Check in DbSchema Help or internet for details.

Check the database timezone settings in postgresql.conf. They should be similar with the operating system settings.
On linux operating system settings using the 'locale' command.

advice.pattern: type "serial" does not exist|type "bigserial" does not exist
advice.message:
Serial and Bigserial are aliases for integer and bigint with autoincrement.
Converting a column to serial will fail in the database.
You may set the column default value from a sequence, like nextval('seq_name').

This error can be caused by a timezone difference between the database server and current computer.
In Options Tab select the client Time Zone same as in the database server.
